alert.note: Alert for Dunn; Stark (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 01 at 9:04PM CDT until August 01 at 9:15PM CDT by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM MDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN DUNN AND NORTHEASTERN STARK COUNTIES... At 804 PM MDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 4 miles northeast of Marshall to 6 miles north of Taylor to 5 miles southeast of Gladstone, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. These severe thunderstorms will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Dunn and northeastern Stark Counties, including the following locations... Hirschville. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
